questions.question: According to Wegener, what happened about 250 million years ago?

choices.answer: The South America and Nazca plates collided.
The supercontinent began breaking into smaller continents.
Magma rose to Earth’s surface and solidified.
The continents drifted to their present locations.

questions.question: The theory that explains why and how continents move is called

choices.answer: continental drift.
paleomagnetism.
plate tectonics.
sea-floor spreading.

questions.question: Wegener’s hypothesis of continental drift was finally confirmed by

choices.answer: fossils from the same reptile found on two continents.
evidence supporting the idea of sea-floor spreading.
continental coastlines that fit together.
the formation of mountain ranges such as the Andes.

questions.question: What is the crack in the ocean floor through which magma rises?

choices.answer: a ridge
a rift
a rip
a slip

questions.question: Tectonic plates can include

choices.answer: only asthenosphere.
only oceanic crust.
only continental crust.
both oceanic and continental crust.

questions.question: The Pacific Ring of Fire is

choices.answer: ﻿a mid-ocean ridge.
a chain of volcanic islands.
a zone of active volcanoes.
a rift valley.

questions.question: An example of a transform boundary is the

choices.answer: San Andreas Fault in California.
San Andreas Fault in California.
San Andreas Fault in California.
San Andreas Fault in California.

questions.question: Frequent earthquakes in an area may indicate

choices.answer: tectonic plate boundaries.
sea-floor spreading.
mantle convection.
reversed polarity.

questions.question: Convection, ridge push, and slab pull work together to produce

choices.answer: ﻿continental lithosphere.
constant tectonic plate motion.
earthquakes.
fracture zones.

questions.question: What is one way tectonic plate movement affects climate?

choices.answer: It creates mountains that affect wind patterns.
It changes the location of the equator and the poles.
It keeps ice sheets from melting.
It keeps air temperatures constant.

questions.question: The splitting of Pangaea into two continents is part of

choices.answer: the process of accretion.
a convection cell.
the process of slab pull.
the supercontinent cycle.

questions.question: Tectonic plates are blocks of

choices.answer: magma.
magnetic rock.
asthenosphere.
lithosphere.

questions.question: At the center of a mid-ocean ridge is a(n)

choices.answer: subduction zone.
fracture zone.
rift valley.
deep-ocean trench.

questions.question: An example of a divergent boundary is

choices.answer: the sea between the Arabian Peninsula and Africa.
the sea between the Arabian Peninsula and Africa.
the sea between the Arabian Peninsula and Africa.
the sea between the Arabian Peninsula and Africa.

questions.question: What occurs at a transform boundary?

choices.answer: Oceanic lithosphere collides with continental lithosphere.
Magma rises to the surface and forms a mid-ocean ridge.
Two plates slide past each other horizontally.
Two plates collide and crumple.

questions.question: Matching Section: asthenosphere

choices.answer: solid layer of plastic mantle rock that flows very slowly
outer layer of Earth made up of the upper part of the mantle and the crust
theory that explains how large pieces of the lithosphere move
region along a plate boundary where one plate moves under another plate
